# hasMarkedText()

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the receiver has marked text.

## Declaration

```swift
func hasMarkedText() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver has marked text; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

The text view itself may call this method to determine whether there currently is marked text. `NSTextView`, for example, disables the Edit > Copy menu item when this method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Handling marked text

- **markedRange()**: Returns the range of the marked text.
- **selectedRange()**: Returns the range of selected text.
- **setMarkedText(_:selectedRange:replacementRange:)**: Replaces a specified range in the receiver’s text storage with the given string and sets the selection.
- **unmarkText()**: Unmarks the marked text.
- **validAttributesForMarkedText()**: Returns an array of attribute names recognized by the receiver.
